children.name: Privacy Policy
Privacy Policy

This privacy policy ("Policy") informs you of practices when handling your Information through the Services (both as defined below). In this Policy, "Focus Calendar", "we" or "us" refers to Focus Calendar Management Inc., a company registered in Delaware, USA.

For the purpose of this Policy, "Information" means individually identifiable information about an individual user collected by the operator from that individual and maintained by the operator in an accessible form. This includes Information you provide or generated when you use:
a. our app Focus Calendar; and
a.
our app Focus Calendar; and
b. website focuscal.com (collectively, “Services”)
b.
website focuscal.com (collectively, “Services”)

This Privacy Policy is intended for individuals in the United States. If you live outside of the United States and choose to use the Services connected with this Privacy Policy, you do so at your own risk and understand that your information will be sent to and stored in the United States.
Before using the Services or submitting any Information to us, please review this Policy carefully and contact us if you have any questions.
By using any of our Services in the United States that contain a link to this Privacy Policy or otherwise providing personal Information to us, you agree to this Privacy Policy.

When you use the Services, you accept and understand we collect, process, use and store your Information as described in this Privacy Policy. If you do not agree with this Privacy Policy, you must not use any of the Services. If you change your mind in the future, you must stop using the Services and you may exercise your rights in relation to your Information as set out in this Privacy Policy.

Scope

visitors and users of the Services;

Sensitive personal information
Sensitive personal information

We ask that you do not send us, and do not share any sensitive personal information (for example, government-issued IDs, information related to racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, religion or other beliefs, health, genetic, or biometric data, trade union membership).
Children’s privacy
Children’s privacy
As a company focused on serving the needs of business users, Focus Calendar's sites and App are not directed to minors.

Our Services are not targeted at children, and we do not knowingly collect Information from children under the age of 18. If you learn that a child has provided us with Information in violation of this Policy, please contact us as indicated below.
Google user data
Google user data
Focus Calendar is able to integrate with the user's Gmail account to let users send emails via Gmail API. The service integrates into Gmail and needs to connect with your Google account.

The only information we store is the email address of the Gmail account you have connected to our service, tokens (access and refresh) and information about the users calendar (for example, events, emails of event participations, we store only in the local database on the user (in IndexedDB)).
We do not store incoming emails from your Gmail account. We do not access your sent emails through your Gmail account.
We delete all data collected from your Gmail account upon request.
Services will show a user's Google calendar data on the scheduling screen of Services, so that users can manage their schedules through Services and sync the changes with their Google calendar.
Focus Calendar use of information received from Google APIs will adhere to Google API Services User Data Policy, including the Limited Use requirements.

What information we collect about you?

Information you provide to us
Information you provide to us
• Registration information: for example, when you create an account on the website or app Focus Calendar, you will be asked to provide your first and last name, email.

We also collect your opinions, preferences, questions, and responses associated with that survey.

Information we automatically collect or is generated about you when use the Services
Information we automatically collect or is generated about you when use the Services

• Identifiers, such as your unique IDs such as your mobile device identifier or cookie ID on your browser; IP address and information that may be derived from IP address, such as geographic location; time zone; information about a device you use, such as browser, device type, operating system.

• Log Data: information that your browser automatically sends when using the Services. Log Data includes you Internet Protocol address, browser type and settings, operating system, the date and time of your request, how you interacted with the Services, and how you interacted with email notifications.

Please note that when you purchase a paid Focus Calendar service “subscription”, your credit card data and Information is not transmitted to us and is not stored on our systems. All of Focus Calendar credit card processing is handled by our third-party payment Stripe. Upon purchase of a service Stripe may collect user’s e-mail address, phone number, billing address, phone number, credit card details and expiry date.
How we use your personal information?
How we use your personal information?
We use your Information to:

A. Provide you with the Services. We will use your Information to perform our contractual obligation towards you to allow you to create an account and use the Services. The Information we process when doing so includes your registration information, information you provide to us when using the Services, identifiers, information you generate when using the Services, and information regarding your use of the Services.
A.

Provide you with the Services. We will use your Information to perform our contractual obligation towards you to allow you to create an account and use the Services. The Information we process when doing so includes your registration information, information you provide to us when using the Services, identifiers, information you generate when using the Services, and information regarding your use of the Services.

B. Improve and monitor the Services. It is in our legitimate interests to improve our Services for our customers. When doing so, we may collect information we automatically collect or is generated about you when you use the Services, as well as non-personal information about your device such as device manufacturer, model and operating system, and the amount of free space on your device.
B.

Improve and monitor the Services. It is in our legitimate interests to improve our Services for our customers. When doing so, we may collect information we automatically collect or is generated about you when you use the Services, as well as non-personal information about your device such as device manufacturer, model and operating system, and the amount of free space on your device.

C. Provide you with support as well as to send administrative information to you (e.g. information regarding the Services and changes to our terms, conditions, and policies) and to respond to your requests or complaints. If you reach out to us for support, we will use your Information to respond to and resolve your queries and complaints and facilitate support (e.g. retrieval of a forgotten password). When doing so, we perform our contractual obligation towards you. The Information we process when doing so includes your registration information, your identifiers, and any other information about you collected via our customer support channels.

When doing so, we perform our contractual obligation towards you. D. Conduct analytics. It is in our legitimate interests to analyse the use of, and any other interaction or interest in our Services. When doing so we will process information we automatically collect or is generated about you when you use the Services to create anonymised and aggregated data regarding your App usage.
D.

Conduct analytics. It is in our legitimate interests to analyse the use of, and any other interaction or interest in our Services. E. Market our products and services or related products and services and to tailor marketing and sales activities. Focus Calendar may use information about you to notify you about new product releases and service developments, events, alerts, updates, prices, terms, special offers and associated campaigns and promotions (including via newsletters). Your consent can be withdrawn at any time by following the unsubscribe mechanism at the bottom of each communication.

Your consent can be withdrawn at any time by following the unsubscribe mechanism at the bottom of each communication.

F. Manage the security of our Services. We may collect site use data for security and operations management to help keep our Services, networks and systems secure, to prevent spam, fraud, abuse, criminal activity, or misuses of our Services, or to investigate and prevent potential fraud, including ad fraud and cyber-attacks and to detect bots.

G. Comply with applicable laws and regulations and to operate our business. In some cases, we have to process personal information to comply with applicable laws and regulations. For example, to respond to a request from a regulator or to defend a legal claim. We may also process personal information in the performance and operation of our business, such as to conduct internal audits and investigations.

If you participate, we process your registration information and any other information collected through the survey questions.

How we use cookies and similar technologies?
How we use cookies and similar technologies?

Cookies are small files that are downloaded to the user's devise and help ensure the normal and safe functioning of the Services. They allow you to collect information about the products that users to the Services are interested in, and also take into account the navigation used when visiting. This is done to ensure the efficient and safe operation of the Service and to improve experience of the users.

Our Services uses Cookies to collect information about your browsing activities and to distinguish you from other users of our Services. This aids your experience when you use our Services and also allows us to improve the functionality of our Services. The information gathered by these cookies that do not identify you personally can be used for marketing purposes.
We use the following cookies:

• Necessary cookies: some cookies are strictly necessary to make our Services available to you; for example, to perform your login functionality and for user authentication and security. We cannot provide you with the Services without this type of cookies.
Necessary cookies:

some cookies are strictly necessary to make our Services available to you; for example, to perform your login functionality and for user authentication and security. We cannot provide you with the Services without this type of cookies.

• Functional cookies: these are used to recognise you when you return to our Website. This enables us to personalise our content for you, remember your preferences (for example, your choice of language or region).
Functional cookies:
these are used to recognise you when you return to our Website. This enables us to personalise our content for you, remember your preferences (for example, your choice of language or region).
• Analytical or performance cookies: we also use cookies for analytics purposes in order to operate, maintain, and improve our Services.
Analytical or performance cookies:
we also use cookies for analytics purposes in order to operate, maintain, and improve our Services.
You can disable cookies in your Internet browser. Also, the user can refuse to store cookies on his device by changing the appropriate browser settings.
Who we share your personal information with?
Who we share your personal information with?

• Other users of the Services who will see your profile information and any other information you choose to share with them through the Services.
Other users of the Services who will see your profile information and any other information you choose to share with them through the Services.

• Cloud service providers who we rely on for data storage, who are based in the U.S.;

who help us manage and respond to our customer questions and complaints. This includes Zendesk Inc., Intercom, which are based in the U.S. and which hosts our customer support function; and

• Payment processors, such as Stripe. This payment processor is responsible for the processing of your Information, and may use your Information for their own purposes in accordance with their privacy policies. More information is available at https://stripe.com/gb/privacy for Stripe.
Payment processors,

such as Stripe. This payment processor is responsible for the processing of your Information, and may use your Information for their own purposes in accordance with their privacy policies. More information is available at https://stripe.com/gb/privacy for Stripe.

• Business Transfers. If we are involved in a merger, acquisition, financing due diligence, reorganization, bankruptcy, receivership, sale of all or a portion of our assets, or transition of service to another provider (collectively a “Transaction”), your Information and other information may be shared in the diligence process with counterparties and other assisting with the Transaction and transferred to a successor or affiliate as part of that Transaction along with other assets.
Business Transfers.

If we are involved in a merger, acquisition, financing due diligence, reorganization, bankruptcy, receivership, sale of all or a portion of our assets, or transition of service to another provider (collectively a “Transaction”), your Information and other information may be shared in the diligence process with counterparties and other assisting with the Transaction and transferred to a successor or affiliate as part of that Transaction along with other assets.

• Law enforcement agencies, public authorities or other judicial bodies and organizations.As required by law, such as to comply with a subpoena or other legal process, when we believe in good faith that disclosure is necessary to protect our rights, protect your safety or the safety of others, investigate fraud, or respond to government requests, including public and government authorities outside your country of residence, for national security and/or law enforcement purposes.
Law enforcement agencies, public authorities or other judicial bodies and organizations.

As required by law, such as to comply with a subpoena or other legal process, when we believe in good faith that disclosure is necessary to protect our rights, protect your safety or the safety of others, investigate fraud, or respond to government requests, including public and government authorities outside your country of residence, for national security and/or law enforcement purposes.

When third parties are given access to personal information, we will take appropriate contractual, technical and organizational measures designed to ensure that personal information is processed only to the extent that such processing is necessary, consistent with this Privacy Policy, and in accordance with applicable law.
Where we store your information?
Where we store your information?

Your Information will be processed by our employees and service providers in the U.S. We take steps to ensure all transfers are protected by adequate safeguards, including the standard contractual clauses.
How long we store your information?
How long we store your information?

Your Information is kept for as long as necessary to achieve the purposes set out above. Generally, it is stored for as long as you are registered and using our Services, and then for up to 5 years from the date you stop using the Services, or promptly following a valid erasure request. Some information we collect will be stored for longer where we have an overriding legitimate interest to retain such information (for example, information on suspicious behaviour of certain users of our Services and transaction records).
When deleting Information, we will take measures to make the Information irrecoverable or irreproducible, and electronic files which contain Information will be deleted permanently.
How is your personal information secured?
How is your personal information secured?

Focus Calendar has implemented appropriate technical, physical and organizational measures designed to protect personal information against accidental or unlawful destruction or accidental loss, damage, alteration, unauthorized disclosure or access, as well as all other forms of unlawful processing.
Links to other websites
Links to other websites

Services may contain links to other websites or services. Please note that these websites and services may have their own privacy policies. We do not accept any responsibility or liability for the policies of any third parties. You are encouraged to check the applicable policies before you use or submit any personal information to such websites or services.
What are your privacy rights?
What are your privacy rights?
You have the right to:
• Know how your personal information is used by Focus Calendar;
Know how your personal information is used by Focus Calendar;
• Access, request and receive the personal information we have collected;
Access, request and receive the personal information we have collected;
• Object to having your data shared;
Object to having your data shared;

• Opt-out of our use or sharing of your personal information. You may withdraw consent you have previously provided for the processing of information about you, including for email marketing by Focus Calendar.

Opt-out of our use or sharing of your personal information. You may withdraw consent you have previously provided for the processing of information about you, including for email marketing by Focus Calendar.
• Request to delete your personal information. You can ask us to erase or delete all or some of the information about you.
Request to delete your personal information. You can ask us to erase or delete all or some of the information about you.

• Change or correct personal information. You can edit some of the information about you by. You can also ask us to change, update or fix information about you in certain cases, particularly if it is inaccurate.

Change or correct personal information. You can edit some of the information about you by. You can also ask us to change, update or fix information about you in certain cases, particularly if it is inaccurate.

• Object to, or limit or restrict use of personal information. You can ask us to stop using all or some of the information about you (for example, if we have no legal right to keep using it) or to limit our use of it (for example, if the information about you is inaccurate).

Object to, or limit or restrict use of personal information. You can ask us to stop using all or some of the information about you (for example, if we have no legal right to keep using it) or to limit our use of it (for example, if the information about you is inaccurate).
• Right to access and/or have your information provided to you.
Right to access and/or have your information provided to you.
• Other rights under applicable data privacy laws, rules or regulations.
Other rights under applicable data privacy laws, rules or regulations.
Contact Us
Contact Us

Your information is controlled by Focus Calendar Management Inc.. If you have questions or concerns about how your information is handled, please direct your inquiry to Focus Calendar Management Inc., 16192 Coastal Highway, Lewes, Delaware 19958, County of Sussex, USA. Email: hi@focuscal.com
Dispute resolution or filing a complaint
Dispute resolution or filing a complaint

If you have any complaints regarding our compliance with this Privacy Policy, please contact us first. We will investigate and attempt to resolve complaints and disputes regarding use and disclosure of personal information in accordance with this Privacy Policy and in accordance with applicable law.
Changes
Changes
This Privacy Policy was last updated on February 12, 2021. However, the Privacy Policy can change over time, for example to comply with legal requirements or to meet changing business needs.

If we make any material changes to this Policy, we will post the updated Policy here and notify our users through the Services and/or newsletters. Please check this page frequently to see any updates or changes to this Policy.
